headline: Live: Saturday trading session | Nifty trades sideways after hitting new all-time high | Closing Bell
content: Saturday Trading Session: Nifty hits new high as it breezes past 22,400. Broader markets were seen in fine fettle, both mid & smallcaps gain. Nifty gainers: Tata Steel, Adani Ports, Hero Moto, Tata Motors, and Dr Reddy's. Saturday special trading session, is Nifty poised to make a new high? The special trading session is being held to evaluate the readiness of Market Infrastructure Institutions (MIIs) in handling unforeseen events such as system outages affecting their operations. As per the schedule, the market will remain open for couple of hours for trading with 75-minute break in between. The session will be  divided into two phases for the transition from the primary site to disaster recovery site.  Watch the special trading session with Nandita Khemka and Kranthi Bathini Equity strategist at WealthMills securities pvt ltd.

headline: Aurobindo Pharma soars 4% on USFDA nod to manufacture Fingolimod capsules
content: Aurobindo Pharma share price today: Fingolimod capsules has an estimated market size of $447.3 million for the twelve months ending January 2024

headline: Financial Intelligence Unit-India imposes penalty of Rs 5.49 cr on PPBL; Paytm down 2%
content: The latest move is a result of the ongoing regulatory action against the payments bank by the RBI. On January 31, the RBI imposed major business restrictions on the Paytm payments bank citing a prolonged history of non-compliance by the Paytm promoters.

headline: F&O Manual| Nifty may continue sideway trade in 22,380-22,410 range with bullish undertone
content: The second half of the session, which begins at 11.30 am, is expected to remain sluggish while holding the underlying bullish trend

headline: Cipla stock gains; US FDA inspection concludes with zero observations
content: Cipla has completed the transfer of its generics business 'as a going concern on a slump sale basis to Cipla Pharma and Life Sciences Limited', the company told bourses

headline: Another day of record highs: Nifty hits 22,420, Sensex 73,982, as analysts remain bullish
content: While analysts expect low trading volumes in today's special session, they continue to remain positive on the market

headline: Hero Motocorp stock gains as February sales rise 19%
content: Hero Motocorp sold 468,410 units in February, a 19 percent more than 394,460 vehicles in the year-ago period

headline: Live: Saturday special trading session | Nifty poised to make new high? Hero Moto, Paytm in focus
content: Saturday special trading session, is Nifty poised to make a new high? The special trading session is being held to evaluate the readiness of Market Infrastructure Institutions (MIIs) in handling unforeseen events such as system outages affecting their operations. As per the schedule, the market will remain open for couple of hours for trading with 75-minute break in between. The session will be  divided into two phases for the transition from the primary site to disaster recovery site. The first session will start at the regular time with eight minutes of pre-open session i.e. 9:00 to 9:08 am, followed by regular trading for 45 minutes between 9:15 am and 10:00 am. Watch the special trading session with Nandita Khemka and Stacy Pereira.

headline: What to expect from today's special trading session? Check Nifty outlook, near-term target
content: With the markets trading in uncharted territory, considering reciprocal retracements, levels around 22,500 and 22,630 are viewed as immediate resistance

headline: How to use OI to add confidence to trading at the top
content: If the OI is going up, it means more buyers and sellers are coming into trading that futures or options contract. If OI is going down, it means traders are exiting the contract

headline: History of major NSE, BSE outages: Check when stock exchanges were disrupted
content: India's two major stock exchanges will today hold two special live trading sessions to transition to a disaster recovery site to strengthen their resilience against unforeseen disruptions

headline: Closing Bell: Nifty ends near 22,400 in special trading session; Sensex closes with minor gains
content: The Nifty opened at a record high on the special trading session on March 2, surpassing the 22,400-mark for the first time, Sensex too followed on and set a new peak, moving closer to the 80,000-mark. Cues from global markets were positive and most sectoral indices also traded in the green which aided the momentum in the market.

headline: Stock Market Today: Top 10 things to know before the market opens
content: Trends in the GIFT Nifty indicate a positive start for the broader index in India, with a gain of 60 points or 0.27 percent.

headline: Daily Voice: This fund manager bets on these 4 themes ahead of general elections
content: While all eyes are on the general elections and a falling interest-rate cycle across the globe, all three elements of the capex cycle (housing, corporate capex & government capex) are now firing, says Dhimant Shah of ITI Mutual Fund.

headline: Buzzing Stocks: Paytm, Infosys, Torrent Power, Maruti Suzuki, PVR Inox, Asian Paints, Aurobindo Pharma, Hero MotoCorp, Axis Bank, Cipla, Lemon Tree Hotels, IRCTC and others in news
content: Stocks to watch: Check out the companies making headlines before the opening bell today, on March 02, 2024.

headline: Trade Spotlight: Your blueprint for Tata Steel, IndusInd Bank, Jindal Steel & Power counters today
content: IndusInd Bank smartly defended its 200-day EMA (exponential moving average) many a times in the recent past. The stock has seen a breakout of downward sloping resistance trendline and climbed 3.5 percent to Rs 1,526.65.

headline: Hot Stocks: V-Guard Industries, Triveni Turbine can give up to 12% return in short term, here's why?
content: considering reciprocal retracements, levels around 22,500 and 22,630 are viewed as immediate resistance for Nifty 50.

headline: Oil rises more than 2% ahead of OPEC+ decision
content: Brent futures for May were up $2.24, or 2.73%, at $84.15 a barrel by 12:08 p.m. EST (1334 GMT). The April Brent futures contract expired on Feb. 29 at $83.62 a barrel.

headline: Stocks climb, yields fall as data supports view of rate cuts
content: The Institute for Supply Management (ISM) said on Friday that its manufacturing PMI fell to 47.8 last month from 49.1 in January. It was the 16th straight month that the PMI remained below 50, which indicates contraction in manufacturing.

headline: Trade setup for Saturday: 15 things to know before opening bell
content: A long build-up was seen in 76 stocks, which included SAIL, TVS Motor Company, Aditya Birla Fashion & Retail, Indus Towers, and National Aluminium Company.

headline: Dollar gains on yen on cautious BOJ, dips against euro
content: In cryptocurrencies, bitcoin held just below a more than two-year high reached on Wednesday.

headline: Gold advances to 4-week peak as US rate cuts expected soon
content: Spot gold edged up 0.6% to $2,054.69 per ounce by 9:29 a.m. ET (1429 GMT), its highest since early February and on track for a second straight weekly rise. U.S. gold futures firmed 0.4% to $2,063.70.

headline: Bulk deals: ICICI Prudential Life Insurance increases stake in Star Health and Allied Insurance
content: Foreign investor Apis Growth 6 sold 1.7 percent stake in Star Health and Allied Insurance

headline: RK Swamy mobilies Rs 187 crore from anchor investors ahead of IPO
content: RK Swamy IPO: The Rs 424-crore initial public offering will be opening for subscription in the coming week on March 4. The last day for bidding will be March 6.

headline: Zomato touches all-time high, surges 200% in one year
content: Zomato expects its topline to grow by 50 percent over the next couple of years. Analysts also see more runway for growth as food delivery business is still in a nascent stage in India.
